definitions.definition: To separate (a mixture) into its individual constituents by exploiting differences in some chemical or physical property, such as boiling point, particle size, solubility etc.
examples: Crude oil is fractionated in a refinery to produce a number of different petroleum products.

definitions.definition: To divide a total dose of radiation into fractions .
To divide each plaintext symbol into several ciphertext symbols as a preliminary stage of encryption .
To use the technique of fractionation in hypnosis .

main_definition: ( chemistry ) To separate (a mixture) into its individual constituents by exploiting differences in some chemical or physical property, such as boiling point, particle size, solubility etc.
secondary_definitions: ( radiotherapy ) To divide a total dose of radiation into fractions .
( cryptography ) To divide each plaintext symbol into several ciphertext symbols as a preliminary stage of encryption .
To use the technique of fractionation in hypnosis .
